meanings.sent1: After the first candidate dropped out, they renominated him for the position.
meanings.sent2: The committee decided to renominate the current president for another term.
meanings.sent3: It was a surprise when they renominated the cat as the best pet in the neighborhood contest.
meanings.sent4: The sun renominated itself every morning, shining brightly in the sky.
meanings.sent5: The teacher renominated the student for the award, recognizing their hard work.

meanings.definition: To propose or formally enter as a candidate for election or appointment again.
meanings.sent1: She renominated herself for class president after a successful term.
meanings.sent2: The party renominated their candidate for the upcoming election.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel renominated itself for the nut-gathering competition, eager to defend its title.
meanings.sent4: The river renominated its course through the valley, shaping the landscape over time.
meanings.sent5: He renominated his best friend for the role, knowing they would excel in it.
